subject: RE: [junit] Dynamically generating test methods?
messageBody:

package junit.xml;

import java.io.File;

import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory;
import javax.xml.transform.TransformerException;

import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;

import org.apache.xpath.XPathAPI;
import org.w3c.dom.Attr;
import org.w3c.dom.Document;
import org.w3c.dom.Element;
import org.w3c.dom.NamedNodeMap;
import org.w3c.dom.Node;
import org.w3c.dom.NodeList;

/**
* Represents a TestCase defined by an XML element:
*
* <pre>
* <test source="documentToCheck.xml">
* <assert-exists xpath="expectedXpath1" />
* <assert-exists xpath="expectedXpath2" />
* <assert-exists xpath="expectedXpath3" />
* </test>
* </pre>
*
* <p>Creates a TestSuite from the system property
* <code>xml.test.file</code>: an XML document with
* root element <code><tests></code>
*
* @author J. B. Rainsberger
*/
public class XmlTestCase extends TestCase {
private final File sourceFile;
private final String[] expectedXpaths;

public XmlTestCase(final File sourceFile, final String[]
expectedXpaths) {
super("XML test '" + sourceFile + "'");
this.sourceFile = sourceFile;
this.expectedXpaths = expectedXpaths;
}

public static Test suite() {
final TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();

final String testFileName =
System.getProperty("xml.test.file", "tests.xml");

try {
final Document document =
DocumentBuilderFactory
.newInstance()
.newDocumentBuilder()
.parse(
testFileName);

final NodeList testNodes =
XPathAPI.selectNodeList(document, "/tests/test");
for (int i = 0; i < testNodes.getLength(); i++) {
final Node eachTestNode = testNodes.item(i);
suite.addTest(makeXmlTest(eachTestNode));
}

} catch (final Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}

return suite;
}

private static XmlTestCase makeXmlTest(final Node eachTestNode)
throws TransformerException {

final String sourceFileName = getAttributeValue(eachTestNode,
"source");

final NodeList assertExistsNodes =
XPathAPI.selectNodeList(eachTestNode, "assert-exists");
final String[] expectedXpaths =
new String[assertExistsNodes.getLength()];
for (int j = 0; j < assertExistsNodes.getLength(); j++) {
final Node eachAssertExistsNode = assertExistsNodes.item(j);
expectedXpaths[j] =
getAttributeValue(eachAssertExistsNode, "xpath");
}

return new XmlTestCase(new File(sourceFileName), expectedXpaths);
}

private static String getAttributeValue(
final Node eachTestNode,
final String attributeName) {

final NamedNodeMap attributes = eachTestNode.getAttributes();
final String sourceFileName =
((Attr) attributes.getNamedItem(attributeName)).getValue();
return sourceFileName;
}

protected void runTest() throws Throwable {

final Document document =
DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance().newDocumentBuilder().parse(
sourceFile);
for (int i = 0; i < expectedXpaths.length; i++) {
String eachExpectedXpath = expectedXpaths[i];
final NodeList nodes =
XPathAPI.selectNodeList(document, eachExpectedXpath);
assertTrue(
"Could not find XPath '" + eachExpectedXpath + "'",
nodes.getLength() > 0);
}
}

}
